name: GetWebhookSubscriptions
description:
Retrieve webhook subscriptions for an organization or user.

This tool fetches a list of webhook subscriptions associated with a specified organization or user. Use it to manage or review existing webhook connections.

parameters.name: organization_identifier
parameters.description: Specify the organization that owns the subscriptions. This field is mandatory.

value_schema.description: The given organization that owns the subscriptions being returned. This field is always required.

parameters.name: filter_by_scope
parameters.description: Filter the subscriptions by organization, user, or group. Expected values are 'organization', 'user', or 'group'.

value_schema.description: Filter the list by organization, user, or group

parameters.name: user_filter
parameters.description: Filter results by user. Required if scope is set to `user`. Provide the user ID.

value_schema.description: Indicates if the results should be filtered by user. This parameter is only required if the `scope` parameter is set to `user`.

parameters.name: filter_by_group
parameters.description: Filter results by group if the `scope` is set to `group`. Provide the group identifier.

value_schema.description: Indicates if the results should be filtered by group. This parameter is only required if the `scope` parameter is set to `group`.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The token used to navigate to the next or previous part of the collection results.

value_schema.description: The token to pass to get the next or previous portion of the collection

parameters.name: number_of_rows_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of webhook subscription rows to return.

value_schema.description: The number of rows to return

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the sort order for the results using a comma-separated list of field:direction pairs (e.g., 'created_at:asc'). Currently, only 'created_at' is supported, with directions 'asc' for ascending and 'desc' for descending.

value_schema.description:
Order results by the specified field and direction. Accepts comma-separated list of {field}:{direction} values.
Supported fields are: created_at.
Sort direction is specified as: asc, desc.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the calendly API.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The given organization that owns the subscriptions being returned. This field is always required.

value_schema.description: The given organization that owns the subscriptions being returned. This field is always required.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Indicates if the results should be filtered by user. This parameter is only required if the `scope` parameter is set to `user`.

value_schema.description: Indicates if the results should be filtered by user. This parameter is only required if the `scope` parameter is set to `user`.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Indicates if the results should be filtered by group. This parameter is only required if the `scope` parameter is set to `group`.

value_schema.description: Indicates if the results should be filtered by group. This parameter is only required if the `scope` parameter is set to `group`.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The token to pass to get the next or previous portion of the collection

value_schema.description: The token to pass to get the next or previous portion of the collection

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of rows to return

value_schema.description: The number of rows to return

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Order results by the specified field and direction. Accepts comma-separated list of {field}:{direction} values.
Supported fields are: created_at.
Sort direction is specified as: asc, desc.

value_schema.description:
Order results by the specified field and direction. Accepts comma-separated list of {field}:{direction} values.
Supported fields are: created_at.
Sort direction is specified as: asc, desc.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Filter the list by organization, user, or group

value_schema.description: Filter the list by organization, user, or group

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
